page.title: 13AGDEN BROOK FARM.
page.content: {During our project a group of first {year pupils visited a farm. Written {below is ZOE FISHER'S account of her {visit. } AGDEN BROOK FARM. Mr Cookson bought this Farm in 1951. We went to visit Mr Cookson on July 11th. 1985. The type of farming Mr Cookson has are Potatoes,Wheat,Barley and Dairy Cattle.Mr Cookson has 160 Milking Cows and 30 dry Cows at any one time.One Cow produces 6,000 litres of milk per year.The cows eat Barley and Silage.Silage is made from cut grass. THe farm had some Charolet and Fresian Bulls.The calfs were sold off at about 14-18 months,they were sold for beef. The Charolet was a creamy colour and the Fresian was black and white.The Bull weighs 900Kg and would cost about Â£1,000.
